entry.title: Jekyll: The configuration file
entry.summary: The Jekyll configuration file houses important information for your site. This post highlights some options being used in this site, with a basic explanation of what it does.

entry.title: Jekyll: Easy searching with JSON and jQuery
entry.summary: Jekyll is a great tool to build web sites, unfortunately there is no built in search. This post will describe how to create one a basic search using JSON and jQuery.

entry.title: Jekyll: Setting up your development environment
entry.summary: Jekyll is a static site generator that runs on NodeJS. Its a great alternative to WordPress that eliminates the need for databases.

entry.title: Creating a development environment for IIS 7+
entry.summary: This post describes how to enable IIS on Windows 7, along with enabling MySql and Php.

entry.title: Moving a Wordpress blog
entry.summary: This post will describe various ways to move WordPress, either to a different server or to Jekyll.

entry.title: How to use Double Twist to sync your iTunes library to a droid
entry.summary: This post describes how you can sync your current iTunes media files to your android device. This tutorial was written and tested on Mac os X mavericks and a Nexus 5.

entry.title: Updated: Raspberry Pi Media Server
entry.summary: After trying quite a few Raspberry Pi operating systems and configurations, the new RasPlex is my choice for my home media centre. RasPlex was the best system which supports out of the box: WiFi, Bluetooth, hdmi monitor with analog speakers, and more. The best thing is the entire process took only 15 minutes!

entry.title: Removing cData from YQL queries
entry.summary: When pulling data from xml items using YQL and getJSON, your application will unfortunately not parse tags that have cdata. This post describe show to use the feed normalizer table to call all elements including those with cdata.

entry.title: Creating the Sticky footer with fixed navbar example with Bootstrap 3 using Emmet.IO
entry.summary: This post described how to use Emmet short codes to quickly create the bootstrap example: Sticky footer with fixed navbar using Bootstrap 3. Feel free to read and implement suggestions.

entry.title: Moving from an iOS Device to Android (iCloud)
entry.summary: Admittedly moving from an iOS device to an android device can seem a bit daunting, especially if you use iCloud for all your syncing. Thankfully there are a few apps on the Google play store that help connect your droid to icloud!
